basics.name: Miguel Guerrero
basics.label: On the hacker path
basics.summary: Penetration Tester with an interest in Red Team exercises

work.summary: Working as a pentester, performing security audits, mostly of web applications
highlights: Found zero-day vulnerabilities in applications used internally

work.summary: Working as a cybersecurity consultant, performing different tasks according to the needs of the clients
highlights: Web, mobile and wireless network pentesting exercises
Analyze and scan infrastructures on a recurring basis in order to find vulnerabilities in systems, using tools such as Nessus
Definition and implementation of use cases in different clients, with the purpose of detecting threats using SIEM tools
Management of the life cycle of digital certificates in public administration
Development of digital transformation projects in Catalan public administration

projects.name: CarLocator
projects.summary: CarLocator is a project that integrates a Raspberry Pi 3 with a GPS module, a Mini ELM327 Interface V2.1 Bluetooth OBD-II, a Web interface developed with Node.js and a Telegram BOT to create a solution for monitoring and tracking of a vehicle.

publications.name: NEO-6M módulo GPS
publications.summary: Tutorial on how to connect and use the NEO-6M GPS module on a Raspberry Pi 3. It is the GPS part of the CarLocator project. (Spanish only)

skills.name: Programming
keywords: Use of Python for develop tools or scripts for automatization
Bash and Powershell to automate tasks via scripts
Knowledge of C++ and Java as object-oriented languages.
C and Assembly as lower level languages

skills.name: Hacking
keywords: Client-side attacks, using frameworks as BeEF or GoPhish
Use of explotation and vulnerability validation tools as Metasploit framework.

skills.name: Blue team
keywords: Basic knowledge of how a soc operates and the creation of use cases

skills.name: Cryptography
keywords: Management of the life cycle of digital certificates
